page.title: 12LIFE IN DARRINGTON-WENTHILLS
page.content: The following information is based on the 1981 census returns for the area. Number of Residents 390. Number of dwellings:130. 114 of these are owner occupied, while a further 10 are occupied by virtue of employment. There is no council accommodation. The majority of the population is in the 30-49 age group. One third of the population are not wage earners. Of those in employment, the great majority are in supervisory employment or are self-employed. The majority of households consist of two persons, with four-person households the next largest group. The number of households with two cars is almost the same as that of households with one car. The Hotel employed 5 residential staff, and catered for resident guests
